trustfund:
TF026468-PHRD-MEXICO: FEDERAL DISTRICT
            URBAN DEVELOPMENT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Affordable Housing and Urban Poverty
            Programming Sector Adjustment Loan Project, represents the
            first of a series of quick disbursing loans to support the
            Government of Mexico's low-income housing and urban
            program. To this end, the project goals focus on seven key
            areas: a) develop a sound national policy and institutional
            framework for housing, and urban development; b)design and
            establish a unified housing subsidy policy that facilitates
            access of low/moderate-income families, to housing, and
            leverages household savings, and private credit finance; c)
            strengthen the housing credit, and savings systems; d)
            strengthen urban real property registries, and rights; d)
            increase the supply of urban land and its access by the
            poor, and improve real estate market functions; e)
            coordinate and support physical and social investments, to
            systematically upgrade poor neighborhoods; and, f) improved
            prevention and management of the impacts of natural
            disasters. Risks however, include a relatively ambitious
            cross-sectoral approach, risking the timing approval of the
            second and third loans in the program. However, this risk
            should be mitigated through the well-designed, integrated
            strategy, and a small number of key prior actions, including
            the intended reform policy.
